ul.li1: 231 When you sit to eat with a ruler,
ul.li2: you shall surely observe what is before you,
ul.li1: 2and you shall put a knife to your throat
ul.li2: if you have a big appetite.Literally “lord/master of life”
ul.li1: 3Do not desire his delicacies,
ul.li2: forHebrew “and” it is food of deception.
ul.li1: 4Do not tire in order to become rich;
ul.li2: out of your understanding, may you desist.
ul.li1: 5Your eyes will alightLiterally “cause to fly” on it, but there is nothing to it,
ul.li2: for suddenly it will make for itself wings
like an eagle and it will be exhausted in the heavens.
ul.li1: 6Do not eat the bread of the stingy,Literally “stingy of eye”
ul.li2: and do not desire his delicacies.
ul.li1: 7For, like hair in his throat,Literally “soul,” or “inner self” so it is.Or “is he”
ul.li2: “Eat and drink!” he will say to you,
but his heart will not be with you.
ul.li1: 8Your morsel you have eaten, you will vomit it up,
ul.li2: and you will waste your pleasant words.
ul.li1: 9In the ears of a fool do not speak,
ul.li2: for he will despise the wisdom of your words.
ul.li1: 10Do not remove an ancient boundary marker,
ul.li2: and on the fields of orphans do not encroach;
ul.li1: 11For their redeemer is strong,
ul.li2: he himself will plead their cause against you.
ul.li1: 12Apply your heartOr “mind” to instruction,
ul.li2: and your ear to sayings of knowledge.
ul.li1: 13Do not withhold discipline from a child,
ul.li2: if you will beat him with the rod, he will not die.
ul.li1: 14As for you, with the rod you shall beat him,
ul.li2: and his lifeOr “soul,” or “inner self” you will save from Sheol.A term for the place where the dead reside, i.e., the Underworld
ul.li1: 15My child, if your heartOr “mind” is wise,
ul.li2: my heart will be glad—even me!
ul.li1: 16And my insidesLiterally “kidneys” will rejoice
ul.li2: when your lips speak what is upright.
ul.li1: 17May your heartOr “mind” not envy the sinners,
ul.li2: but live in fear of Yahweh all day.Literally “all the day”
ul.li1: 18SurelyLiterally “For if” there is a future,
ul.li2: and your hope will not be cut off.
ul.li1: 19You, my child, hear and be wise,
ul.li2: and direct your heartOr “mind” on the road.
ul.li1: 20Do not be among drinkers of wine,
ul.li2: among gluttonous eaters of their meat.Literally “meat for them”
ul.li1: 21For the drunkard and gluttonous, they will become poor,
ul.li2: and with rags, drowsiness will clothe them.
ul.li1: 22Listen to your father—he who gave you life,Literally “caused you to be born”
ul.li2: and do not despise your mother whenOr “for, because” she is old.
ul.li1: 23Buy truth and do not sell it,
ul.li2: wisdom and instruction and understanding.
ul.li1: 24The father of the righteous will surely rejoice;
ul.li2: he who bears a wise person will be happy with him.
ul.li1: 25May your father and your mother be glad,
ul.li2: and may she who bore you rejoice.
ul.li1: 26My child, may you give your heartOr “mind” to me,
ul.li2: and may your eyes delight in my ways.
ul.li1: 27For a deep pit is a prostitute,Or “whore”
ul.li2: and a narrow well is an adulteress.Literally “a foreign woman”
ul.li1: 28She is also like a robber lying in wait,
ul.li2: and the faithless among mankind she increases.
ul.li1: 29To whom is woe? To whom is sorrow? To whom are quarrels? To whom is complaint?
ul.li2: To whom are wounds without cause? To whom is redness of the eyes?
ul.li1: 30To those who linger over wine,
ul.li2: to those who come to try mixed wine.
ul.li1: 31Do not look at wine when it is red,
ul.li2: when it sparklesLiterally “gives its eye” on the cup,
going down smoothly.
ul.li1: 32In the end,Literally “end him” it will bite like a serpent,
ul.li2: and it will sting like an adder.
ul.li1: 33Your eyes will see strange things,
ul.li2: and your heartOr “mind” will speak perverse things.
ul.li1: 34And you will be like him who lies down in the heart of the sea,
ul.li2: and like him who lies down on top of a mast.
ul.li1: 35“They struck me; I was not hurt. They beat me; I did not know it.
ul.li2: When I will awake, I will continue; I will seek it again.”
